historical_growth.growth_rate_source: Based on FCF 3Y CAGR (29.4%) and 5Y CAGR (30.7%), reflecting demonstrated operating leverage and profitability inflection

base.description: Historical FCF growth (~30% CAGR) with gradual deceleration as company scales
base.rationale: Assumes Block continues its profitability trajectory with FCF growing at historical rates. Cash App monetization (ARPU expansion, lending, subscriptions) and operating leverage drive sustained high growth. Deceleration to 12% by Year 5 as company reaches scale.

bull.description: Accelerated growth matching equity/EPS trajectory with margin expansion
bull.rationale: Cash App ARPU exceeds expectations, Afterpay creates BNPL moat, Bitcoin payments drive merchant/consumer adoption. Operating leverage pushes margins higher. Reflects EPS/equity growth trajectory (~40-80% historical).

bear.description: Growth slows to management guidance levels amid competition and macro headwinds
bear.rationale: Competition intensifies (Toast, Stripe, PayPal). Square loses market share. Bitcoin volatility creates user churn. Macro downturn hits SMB and consumer spending. Growth falls to management guidance floor.

key_insights: Block trades at $64.00 vs base case intrinsic value of $68.83 (+7.5% undervalued)
Probability-weighted fair value: $72.77, current price is 12% below blended fair value
Entry price for 15% CAGR: $41.01 - would need 36% pullback from current levels
Historical FCF CAGR of ~30% justifies aggressive base case (25% â†’ 12% growth)
Key sensitivity: At 9% WACC (vs 10% base), intrinsic value rises to $79.37
Wide dispersion: Bear case $42.31 (-34%) vs Bull case $111.11 (+74%)
2024 profitability inflection: EPS +78% CAGR, Equity +86% CAGR demonstrates operating leverage
Management guidance (15%+ GP growth) now represents BEAR case floor, not base case

valuation_summary.rationale: Block trades at $64.00 vs probability-weighted fair value of $72.77, representing 14% upside. Historical FCF growth of ~30% CAGR justifies the base case assumption of 25% declining to 12% over 5 years. The bull case offers 74% upside if Cash App monetization and operating leverage continue at historical rates. Even the bear case (management guidance floor of 15%) yields $42 intrinsic value. The 2024-2025 profitability inflection (EPS +78% CAGR, operating margin expanding from 0.4% to 8.6%) demonstrates Block has crossed a fundamental threshold. Suitable for growth investors comfortable with Bitcoin exposure and competitive risks.

model_notes.fcf_calculation: Operating Cash Flow minus Capital Expenditures. FY2024: $1,707M - $171M = $1,537M
model_notes.growth_rate_approach: Used historical FCF CAGR (~30%) as anchor rather than conservative management guidance. Base case 25% starting rate reflects demonstrated operating leverage. Historical EPS (78% 3Y CAGR) and Equity (86% 3Y CAGR) growth supports aggressive assumptions.
model_notes.wacc_justification: 10% base reflects fintech risk profile, regulatory uncertainty, and Bitcoin exposure. Bull case 9% assumes lower risk as company scales and demonstrates consistent profitability. Bear case 11% reflects competitive and execution risks.
model_notes.terminal_growth: 3% base aligned with nominal GDP growth. Bull 3.5% assumes fintech sector continues growing faster. Bear 2.5% reflects maturing industry and competition.
key_assumptions: FCF margin expands from 6.4% (2024) to 7.5% (base) as operating leverage continues
Share count remains stable ~635M (buyback program offsets dilution)
Net cash position ($1.05B) provides strategic flexibility
Historical growth rates are sustainable for 3-5 years before meaningful deceleration
Management guidance (15%) represents floor, not ceiling, given demonstrated performance
